clinical_summary: On 2025-03-01 laboratory testing revealed markedly elevated SGOT (162 U/L), markedly elevated total bilirubin (9.4 mg/dL), and thrombocytopenia with a platelet count of 95,000/ÂµL, indicating abnormal liver function and low platelet count.

differential_diagnoses.name: Acute hepatitis (viral or drug-induced)
differential_diagnoses.justification: Elevated SGOT and total bilirubin are consistent with acute hepatic injury.

differential_diagnoses.name: Drug-induced liver injury
differential_diagnoses.justification: Pattern of transaminase and bilirubin elevation with concurrent thrombocytopenia can occur with hepatotoxic medications.

differential_diagnoses.name: Severe cholestatic liver disease with portal hypertension
differential_diagnoses.justification: Marked hyperbilirubinemia and low platelet count may reflect impaired bile flow and splenic sequestration.
